watch the debate on bbc one at 22:50 .

documents.title: 'integrated rail network '
text: an audience member asks which other countries have been looked at as a model for high speed rail .
tristram hunt says the german model allows for regional and sub regional cities to fit into rail network .
he says there is a 'great deal of scepticism ' in stoke-on-trent [ his constituency ] about the plans north for birmingham as regeneration in the area is key and they could miss out .

documents.title: 'exciting project '
text: but lorely burt says she thinks its necessary and exciting - `` a fantastic opportunity for the west midlands '' .
'it 's for the future for our country , ' she says .

documents.title: 'no need for hs2 '
text: will duckworth he wants the idea stopped and believes there are other , better ways to spend the money , including improve the current infrastructure .
there are already transport corridors where rail could be increased , he says .
'we need high speed rail but we do n't need hs2 , ' he says .

documents.title: 'invest elsewhere '
text: suzanne evans says she wants the money spent elsewhere as the project will only benefit the few .
but sajid javid disagrees , saying there has not been a major new rail line built outside london in over a century .
he accepts he would not like live alongside the proposed route route but the fears people have are the same when new motorways were built .

documents.title: hs2 : who supports it ?
text: party manifestos show that the greens and ukip say they 'd scrap hs2 and spend the money on something else and labour , the conservatives and the lib dems are committed to the scheme .
here 's a map of the route of hs2 through parliamentary constituencies :

documents.title: convincing case for hs2 ?
text: the final question this evening is from william whiting :
`` the house of lords economic affairs committee said that the government has not yet made a convincing case for the £ 50bn investment in hs2 .
`` does the panel agree ? ''

documents.title: eu controls 'too much ' for business
text: ukip 's suzanne evans says she has run small businesses and her party is the only one to talk about them in their manifesto .
but she says eu controls on the uk mean you can not cut regulation for small businesses .

documents.title: change how we measure growth ?
text: will duckworth says economic growth does not measure what most people think it measures .

'we need to look at what is being manufactured and how peoples ' lives are , how much they are having to spend on the basic necessities of life and measure that instead of just how much money has swapped between things , '' he says .

documents.title: tax avoidance
text: a member of the audience asks about changes to legislation to address historical tax avoidance .
tristram hunt says labour will abolish the nom dom status which allows people to not pay tax on their foreign earnings .
'we need people to pay their fair share . '

documents.title: low growth recorded
text: sajid javid accepts that the latest figures that showed just a 0.3 % growth in the last quarter were weaker than before .
but he said over the last year 'we 're growing faster than any other industrialised economy . '
the slowdown means you should not take a risk with the economic recovery , he says .
economic confidence 'comes first ' .

documents.title: midlands manufacturing
text: lorely burt says a lot more things are now made in the west midlands and the region is being acknowledged more for what it does .
but small business always need the right help to get started and when they 're up and running and the government has created many systems to ensure that happens , she says .

documents.title: economy question
text: an audience member describes small businesses as the `` engine of the economy '' and asks how they will be protected .

documents.title: 'not counting people out '
text: lorely burt says the uk has a points-based system .
but she says the main problem is that `` we have been counting people in this country but we do n't count them out again . '

documents.title: housing pressure
text: an audience member from sutton coldfield asks why focus is on unlimited immigration in europe when birminghams ' development plans means 300,00 homes are to be required by 2031 .
he says he feels the issues is about `` space not race '' .
will duckworth says only about one tenth of our land mass is for human habitation .
'we have the room , ' he says , adding that any housing shortage is because of previous governments not building them .

documents.title: immigration 'good for the uk '
text: sajid javid says immigration has made the uk a greater country but it needs to be controlled which it has n't under labour .
an audience member criticises previous tory governments for their 'appalling ' record on immigration .

documents.title: immigration
text: asab ali in the audience asks : `` what are the parties ' policies on capping immigration ? ''

tristram hunt says pressures on public services have increased and his party wants a fair system , to remain within the eu , pay more on border guards and that people wo n't get benefits 'from day one ' if they come from the eu .

documents.title: panel disagreement
text: the panel disagree about who first introduced private elements into the health service .
but tristram hunt tells the audiences that they are absolutely right to be scared for the health service under a try or lib dem coalition .
'only the labour party is committed to a publicly funded health service , ' he says .

documents.title: 'privatisation elements introduced by labour '
text: conservative sajid javid says labour were the party to first introduced 'competitive elements ' within the nhs which have 'more or less remained ' .
the total private involvement in the nhs over the last five years has gone up from 3 % to 4 % he says .

documents.title: lib dems 'have cost plans for nhs '
text: lorely burt from the lib dems says she thinks health and social care needs to work together .
all services should be centred around an individual in 'a holistic way ' .
the nhs will need £ 8bn a year more investment , according to her party 's figures and only her party as a fully costed plan of how to do that , she says .

documents.title: 'coalition reduced nhs management '
text: lorely burt says they have cut out about 10,000 managers within the nhs but more needs to be done .
government needs to get more people to work together in a 'can-do ' culture , she says .

documents.title: misusing the nhs ?
text: a member of the audience says money could be saved by tackling people who misuse the service .
ukip 's suzanne evans says other efficiencies could be made by spending less money on nhs spin doctors and more money on real doctors , cuts to public relations budget .
she said the management bill 'on labour 's watch ' went up from £ 300m to over £ 1bn .
she adds that her party believes that £ 2bn is coming from so-called 'health tourism ' and ukip want to make sure everyone that comes to the uk has their own health insurance .

documents.title: 'mansion tax ' to help fund nhs
text: labour 's tristram hunt says his party is committed to a mansion tax on properties over £ 2m which would generate £ 2.5bn to go into the health service .
he is critical of the health and social care act the tories , which puts 'hospital against hospital ' he says .
the labour party wants much more integration between health and social care and he says that is where labour would focus their reforms .

documents.title: nhs 'one of the most important things '
text: conservative sajid javid says he thinks everyone in the country believes the nhs is one of the most important things but admits politicians are guilty of using rhetoric .
he thinks all the panel will agree that it should be free , it is unique and we all rely on it and on will agree on the financial challenges that lie ahead .

documents.title: first question
text: the first question is from rex parmley and is about the nhs .
he asks : `` all parties are saying they will throw millions at the nhs , but how will you ensure that money is efficiently used so the nhs is not an endless money pit ? ''

documents.title: the panel
text: here are the politicians taking part this evening :

from left to right : will duckworth of the green party , lorely burt from the liberal democrats , culture secretary sajid javid for the conservatives , tristram hunt from the labour party and suzanne evans - deputy chairwoman of ukip .
